intro: Brassica campestris var. napobrassica, commonly known as Chinese cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stalks and tightly wrapped leaves that form a compact head. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers cool climates with well-drained soil. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. This variety is widely cultivated for its edible leaves and stems, which are used in various Asian cuisines.
